text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Observation
classCode 1..1classCode
Required Pattern: OBS
moodCode 1..1moodCode
Required Pattern: EVN
templateId Slice: Unordered, Open by value:root, value:extension
templateId 1..1templateId
root 1..1root
Required Pattern: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.19
extension 1..1extension
Required Pattern: 2014-06-09
id 1..*If the id element is used to reference a problem recorded elsewhere in the document then this id must equal another entry/id in the same document instance. Application Software must be responsible for resolving the identifier back to its original object and then rendering the information in the correct place in the containing section's narrative text. Its purpose is to obviate the need to repeat the complete XML representation of the referred to entry when relating one entry to another.
code 1..1code
Binding: https://cts.nlm.nih.gov/fhir/ValueSet/2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.3221.7.2 (example)
statusCode 1..1statusCode
code 1..1code
Required Pattern: completed
effectiveTime 0..1effectiveTime
value 0..1value
Binding: https://cts.nlm.nih.gov/fhir/ValueSet/2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.3221.7.4 (preferred)

Documentation for this format

name: Indication (V2)
description: This template represents the rationale for an action such as an encounter, a medication administration, or a procedure. The id element can be used to reference a problem recorded elsewhere in the document, or can be used with a code and value to record the problem. Indications for treatment are not laboratory results; rather the problem associated with the laboratory result should be cited (e.g., hypokalemia instead of a laboratory result of Potassium 2.0 mEq/L). Use the Drug Monitoring Act [templateId 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.123] to indicate if a particular drug needs special monitoring (e.g., anticoagulant therapy). Use Precondition for Substance Administration (V2) [templateId 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.25.2] to represent that a medication is to be administered only when the associated criteria are met.

element.label: Exceptional Value Detail
element.definition: If a value is an exceptional value (NULL-value), this specifies in what way and why proper information is missing.
When valued in an instance, this attribute signals the imposition of realm-specific constraints. The value of this attribute identifies the realm in question

When valued in an instance, this attribute signals the imposition of constraints defined in an HL7-specified message type. This might be a common type (also known as CMET in the messaging communication environment), or content included within a wrapper. The value of this attribute provides a unique identifier for the type in question.
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] templateId (CONF:1098-7482) such that it
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] templateId (CONF:1098-7482) such that it
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" (CodeSystem: HL7ActClass urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 STATIC) (CONF:1098-7480).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" (CodeSystem: HL7ActMood urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 STATIC) (CONF:1098-7481).

element.label: If the id element is used to reference a problem recorded elsewhere in the document then this id must equal another entry/id in the same document instance. Application Software must be responsible for resolving the identifier back to its original object and then rendering the information in the correct place in the containing section's narrative text. Its purpose is to obviate the need to repeat the complete XML representation of the referred to entry when relating one entry to another.
element.short: If the id element is used to reference a problem recorded elsewhere in the document then this id must equal another entry/id in the same document instance. Application Software must be responsible for resolving the identifier back to its original object and then rendering the information in the correct place in the containing section's narrative text. Its purpose is to obviate the need to repeat the complete XML representation of the referred to entry when relating one entry to another.
element.definition: SHALL contain at least one [1..*] id (CONF:1098-7483).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code, which MAY be selected from ValueSet Problem Type urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.3221.7.2 STATIC 2014-09-02 (CONF:1098-31229).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] statusCode (CONF:1098-7487).
SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] effectiveTime (CONF:1098-7488).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] value with @xsi:type="CD", where the code SHOULD be selected from ValueSet Problem urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.3221.7.4 DYNAMIC (CONF:1098-7489).
Drawn from concept domain ActSite

element.label: Exceptional Value Detail
element.definition: If a value is an exceptional value (NULL-value), this specifies in what way and why proper information is missing.
When valued in an instance, this attribute signals the imposition of realm-specific constraints. The value of this attribute identifies the realm in question

When valued in an instance, this attribute signals the imposition of constraints defined in an HL7-specified message type. This might be a common type (also known as CMET in the messaging communication environment), or content included within a wrapper. The value of this attribute provides a unique identifier for the type in question.
When valued in an instance, this attribute signals the imposition of a set of template-defined constraints. The value of this attribute provides a unique identifier for the templates in question

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] templateId (CONF:1098-7482) such that it

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @extension="2014-06-09" (CONF:1098-32570).

element.label: If the id element is used to reference a problem recorded elsewhere in the document then this id must equal another entry/id in the same document instance. Application Software must be responsible for resolving the identifier back to its original object and then rendering the information in the correct place in the containing section's narrative text. Its purpose is to obviate the need to repeat the complete XML representation of the referred to entry when relating one entry to another.
element.short: If the id element is used to reference a problem recorded elsewhere in the document then this id must equal another entry/id in the same document instance. Application Software must be responsible for resolving the identifier back to its original object and then rendering the information in the correct place in the containing section's narrative text. element.definition: SHALL contain at least one [1..*] id (CONF:1098-7483).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code, which MAY be selected from ValueSet Problem Type urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.3221.7.2 STATIC 2014-09-02 (CONF:1098-31229).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] statusCode (CONF:1098-7487).
This statusCode SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @code="completed" Completed (CodeSystem: HL7ActStatus urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.5.14 STATIC) (CONF:1098-19105).
SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] effectiveTime (CONF:1098-7488).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] value with @xsi:type="CD", where the code SHOULD be selected from ValueSet Problem urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.3221.7.4 DYNAMIC (CONF:1098-7489).
